extendedInfo.description: Malaysia Traffic Application:-1. AES Detector2. Traffic CCTV~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~`1. AES Detector FunctionThe authority is implementing AES enforcement on certain road stretches/spots which have been identified as dangerous and caused many accidents.Instead of spending the money to fix the dangerous spots/roads to become safer for the public, they chose to spend millions of RM to install the AES system.Therefore, we've developed this app so that the public can detect the AES or dangerous spots as claimed by the authority. This app can warn you the dangerous spots/AES and also prevent you from being penalised.The app will warn you when you are driving within the AES radius. We've included the 14 locations which have been disclosed earlier and you can add more locations into the database after the authority has finished all the installation. If the authority change the locations, you can also change it in the app database.You can choose to use either GPS or Network. GPS is more accurate but very battery consuming. With Network, the accuracy is less accurate but faster and less battery consuming.You can also setup the AES radius distance to suit your own preference but the default value is 2 KM.This app is not only for AES detector but you can also use it as a location detector which can come to your imagination.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~`2. Traffic CCTV FunctionMalaysia traffic CCTV application. This traffic CCTV app is only applicable for Malaysia. Avoid getting stuck and wasting your time and money in traffic-jam.Plan your traveling or "balik kampung" journey in Malaysia using this app. By using the CCTVs you can view whether the traffic is clear or congested or if there is any accident.You can also utilise any strategically located CCTV to monitor your car/vehicle when you park at R&R, especially at Sg Perak or Pagoh.You can zoom the picture but the quality depends on the CCTV.View traffic condition in Malaysia using the CCTVs installed at:-1. SILK (Kajang Traffic Dispersal)2. NPE (New Pantai Expressway)3. PLUS (North and South)4. KESAS (Shah Alam Expressway)5. SPRINT (KL Traffic Dispersal)6. Penang Bridge 7. AKLEH (Ampang Elevated)8. LDP (Damansara/Puchong)9. LEKAS (Kajang/Seremban)10. Putrajaya11. ITIS (DBKL - Integrated Transport Information System)12. SHAPADU (North Klang Straits Bypass)13. Singapore Woodlands~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Please bear in mind that the quality and availability of the images depend on the CCTVs' condition which are NOT maintained by us. Relay your complaints to the relevant authorities.~By Mouse Click Ent
